episodeTitle: Almost to Luffy! Gather at the Courthouse Plaza!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィ目前！裁判所前広場へ集結せよ
episodeTitleRomanized: Luffy Mokuzen! Saibanshomae Hiroba e Shuuketsu se yo
description: The Straw Hats continue their assault on Enies Lobby, with Gomorrah charging forward despite being blinded. As casualties mount and chaos spreads across the island, Luffy reaches the courthouse roof to face CP9's Blueno. In a pivotal moment, Luffy reveals a new technique that will change the course of the battle.

events.title: Gomorrah Blinded But Persists
events.description: The Just Eleven Jurymen's giant iron balls strike Gomorrah's head, damaging his retinas and blinding him. Despite losing his sight, Gomorrah continues charging toward the courthouse, determined to fulfill his promise to Sodom.
events.significance: Demonstrates Gomorrah's loyalty and determination to help rescue Franky, the man who saved him and Sodom from a Sea King. This moment showcases the theme of unwavering commitment despite overwhelming adversity.

quotes.text: Gomorrah made a promise to Sodom that he would take us to the courtyard!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Explaining why Gomorrah continues despite being blinded

events.title: Oimo and Kashii Defect from World Government
events.description: The giants Oimo and Kashii officially defect from their positions as gatekeepers after learning that Dorry and Brogy were never captured by the Marines. They now actively help the Straw Hats cross the main island.
events.significance: Reveals the World Government's deception and manipulation of the giants. This defection provides crucial support to the Straw Hats and demonstrates how the World Government maintains control through lies.

events.title: Nami's Upgraded Perfect Clima Tact
events.description: Nami demonstrates her upgraded Perfect Clima Tact, creating a powerful thundercloud that defeats multiple attacking Marines with lightning strikes.
events.significance: Shows Nami's continued growth as a combatant and the effectiveness of Usopp's weapon upgrades. Demonstrates the crew's overall power increase since entering the Grand Line.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Building Demolition
events.description: Zoro cuts through stone structures with ease while Sanji executes high-speed kicks. The duo works together to destroy buildings blocking their path, clearing the way for the crew's advance.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Monster Trio's significant power growth and their ability to work together when needed, despite their constant bickering.

events.title: Spandam's Casualty Report - Over 2000 Down
events.description: Spandam receives devastating news: approximately 60 intruders have breached the Main Island, causing over 2,000 casualties among World Government forces. More than half of these casualties (over 1,000) were caused by Luffy alone.
events.significance: Demonstrates the unprecedented scale of the attack on Enies Lobby, marking this as the worst day in the island's history. Shows Luffy's overwhelming power and the severity of declaring war on the World Government.

events.title: Straw Hats Reach the Courthouse Plaza
events.description: After fighting through the Main Island, the Straw Hat Pirates successfully reach the Courthouse Plaza. Zoro slices through the gate, granting them access to the final area before Robin.
events.significance: Marks the successful completion of the first phase of the rescue operation. The crew is now positioned to storm the courthouse and rescue Robin from CP9.

events.title: Luffy vs Blueno on the Courthouse Roof
events.description: Luffy reaches the courthouse rooftop where he faces CP9 agent Blueno. Blueno demonstrates his mastery of Rokushiki techniques, using Soru to move at incredible speeds and attacking with Shigan and Rankyaku.
events.significance: Sets up the battle that will showcase Luffy's new power. This is Luffy's first one-on-one fight with a CP9 member, testing his growth since their previous encounter.

events.title: Blueno's Tekkai 'Sai' Variation
events.description: Blueno demonstrates a variation of the Tekkai technique called Tekkai 'Sai', showcasing the advanced Rokushiki techniques that CP9 members possess.
events.significance: Reveals the depth of CP9's martial arts abilities and the various techniques within the Rokushiki system.

events.title: Luffy's Motivation - Protecting His Friends
events.description: Luffy explains his motivation for developing a new technique. After being defeated by Admiral Aokiji, he realized that if they encountered more people of that strength, he wouldn't be able to protect his friends unless he became stronger.
events.significance: Provides crucial character development for Luffy, showing his growth from a carefree fighter to someone who strategically prepares for future threats. References his traumatic defeat by Aokiji.

quotes.text: When Aokiji defeated me...I thought if I'm to encounter more strong guys like him in the future I won't be able to protect my friends unless I become stronger.
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Gear 2 Revealed - Luffy's Ultimate Power-Up
events.description: In the episode's climactic moment, Luffy reveals his new technique: Gear 2. He enters a stance and pumps his legs, dramatically increasing his blood flow. Steam erupts from his body as his skin takes on a reddish hue, signaling a massive increase in speed and power.
events.significance: This is one of the most iconic moments in One Piece history. Gear 2 represents Luffy's first major transformation ability and marks a turning point in his fighting capability. This technique allows him to compete with top-tier opponents and shows his creativity in using his Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.text: I needed a way to be stronger in order to protect my friends. I developed a new technique to take my abilities one step higher. I call it... Gear 2!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Revealing Gear 2 for the first time

quotes.text: Gomorrah made a promise to Sodom that he would take us to the courtyard!
quotes.speaker: Chopper

quotes.text: When Aokiji defeated me...I thought if I'm to encounter more strong guys like him in the future I won't be able to protect my friends unless I become stronger.
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: I needed a way to be stronger in order to protect my friends. I developed a new technique to take my abilities one step higher. I call it... Gear 2!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how past defeats and challenges drive the characters to become stronger. Luffy's development of Gear 2 stems directly from his defeat by Aokiji.
themes.symbolism: The steam emanating from Luffy's body represents the heat of his determination and the physical manifestation of his burning desire to protect his friends.

themes.description: Gomorrah's determination to continue despite being blinded, and the giants' defection after learning the truth, both showcase the theme of loyalty to one's true allies.
themes.symbolism: Gomorrah's blindness yet continued charge symbolizes blind faith and unwavering commitment to promises made.

themes.description: A small group of pirates (60 people including allies) successfully invades the World Government's judicial island, causing over 2,000 casualties among their forces.
themes.symbolism: The massive casualty count demonstrates how determination and willpower can overcome numerical superiority.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy reveals the culmination of his training and determination. His willingness to push his body to extreme limits shows maturity and strategic thinking not always present in early arcs.
keyActions: Battles Blueno on the courthouse roof
Explains his motivation stemming from the Aokiji defeat
Reveals Gear 2 for the first time
quotes: When Aokiji defeated me...I thought if I'm to encounter more strong guys like him in the future I won't be able to protect my friends unless I become stronger.

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being blinded, Gomorrah continues forward, demonstrating the loyalty that Franky inspired in him and Sodom.
keyActions: Gets blinded by the Just Eleven Jurymen
Continues charging toward the courthouse despite blindness
Carries the Straw Hats toward their goal

characterSpotlights.role: Antagonist realizing the severity of the situation
characterSpotlights.development: Spandam's panic increases as he learns about the massive casualties and the unprecedented invasion of Enies Lobby.
keyActions: Realizes the magnitude of the Straw Hats' assault
Begins to panic about the situation

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several battle scenes, particularly Gomorrah's charging sequence and the Straw Hats' progress across the Main Island.
The episode ends with Gear 2's activation, while the manga shows this in Chapter 387 with the actual use of Gear 2 continuing into Chapter 388.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Gear 2, one of the most iconic power-ups in One Piece and a defining moment in the series.
The opening song 'Brand New World' by D-51 only covered 15 episodes (264-278), making it one of the shortest-running openings in the series.

sources.title: Brand New World - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 278 was the last episode to feature an ending theme until 2023, a gap of 17 years. 'Adventure World' was the final ending for this extended period.
The episode covers portions of manga Chapters 385-387, with Chapter 387 titled 'Gear' being the pivotal chapter for Luffy's power-up revelation.
The casualty report of over 2,000 World Government forces makes the Enies Lobby assault the most devastating attack on a World Government facility shown up to this point in the series.
